alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morris, northern Hunterdon, southern Warren and northern Somerset Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hampton, or 11 miles east of Easton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Bridgewater, Dover, Wharton, Washington, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mendham, High Bridge, Clinton, Peapack And Gladstone, Glen Gardner, Chester, Victory Gardens, Hampton, Lebanon, Califon, Far Hills, Bloomsbury and Brass Castle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 41. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 37. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 17 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
